Dataset

The dataset will be released once our paper is accepted.

Download links

All data used for training and validation of RES-SIM are listed here (public availabile in the future). Experimentally obtained data were captured by our home-built Multi-modality SIM system (2D-SIM, TIRF-SIM, GI-SIM and 3D-SIM)and home-built Lattice-light-sheet SIM system (LLS-SIM).

No. Samples Imaging modailty Lables Pixel size Frame/volume rate Frame/volume number FOV Comments
1 CCPs in fixed cell* TIRF-SIM N.A. 62.6nm*62.6nm N.A. N.A. 31μm*31μm Low-SNR for training and high-SNR for reference
2 MTs in fixed cell* TIRF-SIM N.A. 62.6nm*62.6nm N.A. N.A. 31μm*31μm Low-SNR for training and high-SNR for reference
3 ER in fixed cell* TIRF-SIM N.A. 62.6nm*62.6nm N.A. N.A. 31μm*31μm Low-SNR for training and high-SNR for reference
4 MTs in fixed COS-7 cell 3D-SIM N.A. 62.6nm*62.6nm*160nm N.A. N.A. 31μm*31μm*3.3μm Low-SNR for training and high-SNR for reference
5 Lyso in fixed COS-7 cell 3D-SIM N.A. 62.6nm*62.6nm*160nm N.A. N.A. 31μm*31μm*2.3μm Low-SNR for training and high-SNR for reference
6 Mito in fixed COS-7 cell LLS-SIM N.A. 92.6nm*92.6nm*185.2nm N.A. N.A. 31μm*31μm*2.3μm Low-SNR for training and high-SNR for reference
7 ER in fixed COS-7 cell LLS-SIM N.A. 92.6nm*92.6nm*92.6nm N.A. N.A. 31μm*31μm*2.3μm Low-SNR for training and high-SNR for reference
8 CCPs in live SUM-159 cell TIRF-SIM N.A. 62.6nm*62.6nm*135nm 0.5s 5000 64μm*64μm Low-SNR time-lapsed
9 CCPs and F-actin in live SUM-159 cell TIRF-SIM N.A. 62.6nm*62.6nm*135nm 3s 170 64μm*64μm Low-SNR time-lapsed
10 MTs and lyso in live COS-7 cell 3D-SIM N.A. 62.6nm*62.6nm*135nm 10 400 31μm*31μm*33μm Low-SNR time-lapsed
11 Mito and MTs in live COS-7 cell LLS-SIM N.A. 62.6nm*62.6nm*102nm 12 313 31μm*31μm*40μm Low-SNR time-lapsed

*Data from open-source dataset bioSR. For more information about these data, please refer [1].

Reference

[1]Qiao C, Li D, Guo Y, et al. Evaluation and development of deep neural networks for image super-resolution in optical microscopy[J]. Nature Methods, 2021, 18(2): 194-202.
